Reviews.Title: Good price - GREAT Phone
Reviews.Author: C. R. Jackson
Reviews.Content: The husband and I are no longer under contract, and did not want to get back into one just to get an affordable phone with the features he needs. An unlocked cell phone seemed to fit our requirements, but I was skeptical. However, based on the prior reviews, and on other information I found on the web about this particular phone, I decided to try it. The vendor confirmed that this model would work with the T-Mobile SIM card. Sure enough, it does! Sound quality is really good, and it has pretty much every feature you'd find in similar phones (the Blackberry Curve comes to mind). Calendar, messaging, web capable, this phone is a virtual office in the palm of his hand.The phone is also aesthetically pleasing and distinctive. So far, the hubby is extremely pleased with it - and that's saying something.If you need a quality phone, but don't want to be slave to a cell contract, or shell out hundreds of dollars, seriously consider this one. The price is right, and the phone, at least for us, was even better.

Reviews.Title: Gives you exactly what you're looking for
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: This is a cool phone. Great for texting, calls, even has a camera on it. Battery life is good too. You can also access the Internet on it. Easy to set up, easy to use. You can even make your own ringtones for it!

Reviews.Title: Save Your Money
Reviews.Author: S. Green
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an unlocked GSM phone that was good for talking and texting and that didn't cost a fortune. After reading a few reviews I thought this would be a good choice. The phone is light weight with a good sized screen, but the amenities stop there. The keys are extremely small and hard to use at an adequate speed when texting or dialing a number. The camera gives you a grainy picture at best and in order to send a text I can honestly say that if you don't happen to know the persons cell number by memory, this phone requires a ridiculous amount of steps before you hit the Send button not to mention that hardly any of us remembers numbers anymore since contact numbers are programmed into every cell phone. If you need to send a text to a contact in your phone here are the steps that are required: Choose (1) Create Message, (2) type your message, (3) choose Send To, (4) choose Options, (5) select Add Recipients, (6) choose Address Book, (7) pick the contact you want your message to go to, (8)choose the checked box, (9) push the Add button, (10) go back up the recipients name and (11) highlight it and (12) then press Send.  This phone is adequate at best. It would probably be great for a kid in grade school who needs to keep in contact with his or her parents. As for an adult, DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Functionality!!
Reviews.Author: George and Marcus Retail Group
Reviews.Content: Wow! When I first bought this phone I was very happy because the ease of use, and the fact that not a lot of people have one. It is great for everything it offers. If I had to recommend this product there would be no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: cell phone replacement
Reviews.Author: R. Irwin
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for replacement of my old one since I'm still under contract and dont qualify for new one, it works flawlessly, charges really fast and holds charge better than LG and Razor which by the way broke before i could qualify for new one. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Just what we wanted
Reviews.Author: M. Garnaat
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my wife so she could have something nice for texting.  Plus, she visits the UK frequently and we wanted a phone that we could put a Tesco SIM card in while she is over there.  It has worked flawlessly both in the UK as well as on the AT&T; network here in the states.  It does exactly what it says it will do.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Easier texting, easy to carry
Reviews.Author: Thrifty
Reviews.Content: I wanted a simple lightweight quad GSM phone that I could use for calling and texting.  This fits the bill: - light, easy to carry in a pant or shirt pocket - easy to text but with my chunky fingers I generally use a stylus of some kind - basic phone functions are straight forward - battery life seems good - I charge every few days - quad GSM should work internationally - ATT SIM card from old phone fired up without missing a beat.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but be warned, does not support 3G network.
Reviews.Author: M. Duran
Reviews.Content: I assumed incorrectly that a later model phone such as this would be on the "3g" network, which is significant, as the 2g GSM network is being slowly dismantled and spectrum is being moved to 3G and 4G endeavors.  Also, if you have a 3G Microcell in your house to boost coverage at home, this phone won't connect to that, either.Other than that, it's a good, cheap, basic, no-contract phone that makes texting reasonably easy.

Reviews.Title: the best phone ever how can it only be $83?
Reviews.Author: Beccabug
Reviews.Content: i bought this phone because i needed a cheep unlocked phone to last me till november but the moment i opened the box i fell in love! The shiny blackshell pared with the brightly colored backgrounds gives it a real polished look. The set up is very user friendly  get this phone don't look at anything else!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: Sean C. Ryan
Reviews.Content: I don't care what "options" my phone has as long as it can dial and have a decent call volume.  This phone has been perfect, plus now I am learning to text!!  Truly a nice phone...

Reviews.Title: Lasts Forever...
Reviews.Author: Audra
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone once my blackberry died... I will say that it ain't no blackberry but it gets the job done. It won't accept lightening fast texting but the keys are very similar. I've had it for 2 1/2 years now and it still acts the same as the day I got it. Awesome phone for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good Stuff
Reviews.Author: T. Gumbo
Reviews.Content: Great phone, came just in time for my trip overseas, was buying it for family was concern once overseas (zimbabwe) might not work, worked perfectly quality is great. nice basic phone. couldnt be more happy

Reviews.Title: good for a while...
Reviews.Author: AHartley96
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone on June 28th 2010. Let me give you some background information before I write this review to tell you what use this phone had...I am a pretty heavy texter, about 400 a day so I could easily fill 2 of the phones inboxes and I talk about 250-300 minutes a month and occasionally use the internet on the phone.  It was all good with the phone for about 9 months. The speaker worked great, the camera is tolerable for what you pay, holds contacts, buttons are small but you get used to them, ringer is loud and vibrate is quiet, you can have animated wallpapers which I like a lot, and overall it is a tolerable cell phone. Now to the bad, well for starters to turn off vibrate and make it completely silent you need to navigate the menus to find out where the sound menu is. Also, where the directional buttons are around the center button the one that goes right is programmed to go to the internet to refill account, well every time you hit the button by accident because the phone is not as fast as you would like it literally nickel and dimes you, this same thing happens with the center button. Also, I downloaded this FACEBOOK CHAT app which cost 5 bucks and I carefully read the directions and it will not work, this is also an annoyance because loaded FACEBOOK takes FOREVER so I thought hey this chat thing may be good-nope! If you want an internet phone, this is not for you! It is very slow and holds like 15 favorites and has pretty bad graphics so you can't see what you're doing. Not to mention the amount of money the internet will cost on this thing. It seems like 2 dollars a minute on the internet and the data packages aren't very good either. The casing on the phone looks acceptable but every time you drop the stupid thing the battery covers flies off along with the battery. Also, the finish scratches very easily and the paint off the battery cover will chip. Also, me being a teenager I have texted in school, the only problem is trying to be quiet because these buttons make so much noise and when the room is quiet the buttons sound so loud. A few weeks ago I had this phone in my backpack on the last day of school and my backpack I believe is an average weight and I had my phone in one of the pockets and my iPOD and the screen on the phone cracked and it is so hard to read the time and text now, and the crack isn't in the middle of the screen like you'd think its on the stronger edge of it which makes me question its strength. Also, on the day it turned 1 year old vibrate just stopped working and the screen has been freezing, its been dropping calls, not sending texts, and NO web access.All in all for a short time, this phone will do but if you want a long term one than go with something else. I am now getting the LG PRIME...it just arrived and you can see my review on that and the nikon finepix s2950

Reviews.Title: Perfect for texting and voice
Reviews.Author: Brian Keightley "77forester"
Reviews.Content: This barebones phone is great for texting and voice. It's not flashy, but if you are looking for a cheap reliable phone and you don't have a need for data/internet, this is the phone for you!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jack Girvin
Reviews.Content: I first bought this phone 5 years ago in store. It was time to get a new one. I don't need an iPhone, i get everything I need from this phone. I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Latoya
Reviews.Content: Brought this phone for my Godfather & he's not into the touch screen phones & little buttons so I brought him this so he would at least feel a little more advanced (his previous phone was a flip phone). Now he loves it, he can text without any hassle, & he feels he has the "newest phone" lol

Reviews.Title: Nice but very basic
Reviews.Author: J. Gale "Schnauzer Lover"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a phone to replace my flip phone so it would be easier texting.  I found the Samsung A177, and I liked the idea that I did not have to change my phone plan with T-Mobile (because I was not adding internet access to it).  I didn't even have to contact T-Mobile at all since it was UNlocked....I just took my SIM card from my old phone and put it in this one.  One thing I did notice is when I chose "copy contacts" from my SIM card to the new phone, a few contacts did not copy over.  So, you might want to make sure you have your contacts written down somewhere so you have that info. if you need to input it again.  The other thing I had a small issue with is the very limited number of ring tones if you do NOT have internet access on your phone.  But, it's a phone, and it rings and it works.  I like the keyboard much better for texting, altho you need to have fingernails and/or a stylus.  It takes great pictures.  Oh, one last thing I don't like is the instruction manual.....could they get the print any smaller?!?!?!?!  Overall, it's an improvement over a flip phone, so it satisfied my needs.

Reviews.Title: Loyal Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Abraham
Reviews.Content: I've had my samsung cell phone for 5 years.  My wife has a Samsung Galaxy Note.  They're good and reliable.  So I wanted to buy one for my kid.  And the price on this item caught me.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: I'm Just Saying.
Reviews.Content: Bought unlocked in Sept 2010 for $100.Very light and slim.Sloped and sturdy key board buttons make it very easy to type.Battery life is good but deceptive in that the first 4 bar will drain very fast but the last bar represent more than 30% of it's remaining power.Camera is 0.3 mega pix I believe, can't extract pics (drag and drop) into a computer directly.No video recording.Came with just a battery charger (no head set, no car charger, etc.)Slipper exterior so I bought a silicon cover + a car charger (haven't use) for like $5 plus shipping on here.Haven't use it's internet functions so I can't review it.Built in memory (64MB I think) with no slot for external memory.Sometimes will auto reboot without warning, right after freezing, happens when I type Notes too much or too fast.Overall, a very good phone for the price, and very convenient in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Okay but
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "afallon"
Reviews.Content: This was 2nd Samsung--I purchased--first was different model that I sent back because I couldn't get the back off--I don't have that problem with this one--in fact the back comes off all the time. I got this phone because of the keyboard and I had gotten my Ericsson Wet (end of Sept--Ericsson completely stopped working 2nd week in Feb)At first the back falling off was rare--not so much now. The ring tones that come with the phone leave a lot to be desired--to add new you have to buy them and you can't change the tone for text msgs--which I never hear and until I bought a ring tone, I had not been able to hear that ring tone either--it now drops calls constantly unless you sit very still and don't dare move your head. The good thing is the keyboard but the numbers are impossible to see in certain light--so sometimes dialing a number can be an adventure. I got this phone because I didn't want another contract and now you have to have a contract with most go phones so not sure what I will do--but no more Samsungs

Reviews.Title: Samsung SGH a177
Reviews.Author: Debb
Reviews.Content: Had to send the phone back due to the small keys. Numbers are flushed to the left too much making one handed usage difficult for this lefty.

Reviews.Title: Everything I was looking for
Reviews.Author: pSudiO "MrOak"
Reviews.Content: My old phone stopped working and didn't want to commit for another two years with the phone company just to get a new phone free (like there's anything free anyone really gives any time!!) Other than the cool slider feature, the phone had everything I needed - lightweight and small enough to carry in a shirt pocket, GSM compatibility, QWERTY keyboard, camera, one button "lock phone", and above all it was also unlocked, so I could simply switch my SIM card from the previous phone and I was ready to roll.  Even after I switchover the plan to another carrier (that supports GSM phones) I would still be able to keep this as my back up phone.  I am sure at least someone's phone in the family will stop working within two years and instead of paying 5 dollars a month for "phone insurance", having bought this 90 dollar phone will also give me a lot better "coverage" should any of the phones stop working during the two year period.

Reviews.Title: JUST GOT IT, BUT SO FAR, IT'S A GREAT DEVICE FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: srd
Reviews.Content: SOLID QUALITY FEEL - ATTRACTIVE- BASIC TEXTING PHONE AT A GREAT PRICE.OTHER REVIEWS I READ  COMPLAINED ABOUT THE KEY SIZE. I'M ASSUMING THEY WERE COMPARING TO A SLIDE OUT KEYBOARD.IVE HAD SEVERAL PHONES WITH THIS SIZED KEYBOARDS INCLUDING A BLACKBERRY PEARL. IN MY OPINION THERE'S NOT A NOTICEABLE DIFFERENCE IN SIZE.BASIC FUNCTIONS AT A BASIC PRICENO COMPLAINTS SO FAR

Reviews.Title: Poor reception
Reviews.Author: Omid
Reviews.Content: I got this cell phone (Samsung A177 unlocked) for my wife to replace her old Nokia 6350. She really liked it, it is  a small, sturdy basic cellphone with reasonable price, however after we moved from Upstate NY to North Liberty in IA, the phone reception dropped significantly in our new house and most of the time it did not pick any signals so she went back to her old Nokia. The other drawback is that  transferring photos from the cell phone to a computer is not easy but the main issue was it's poor reception.

Reviews.Title: A177 Arrived Defective
Reviews.Author: Steve Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: This was a test purchase.  I need two unlocked GSM phones for our foreign travel.  They will replace our Sony-Ericsson bricks circa 2007.When it arrived, the zero key didn't work; can't even place a phone call.  Called Samsung tech support. Tried a re-set, didn't help.  When they checked the IMEI number they said it was out of warranty despite a specific statement at Amazon that there is one.  The only way they "might" honor the warranty is if I sent it to them postage pre-paid with dated proof of purchase (no problem, so far) but the proof had to include the IMEI number.  That killed it.Plan B was a non-starter...send it back to Samsung & they'll charge me for a repair.It was so much easier to simply return it to Amazon (they paid transport) for a full refund, which I did.  Amazon is so good about this.  Buying from Amazon is the only way to go for electronic products.My foray into replacement phones did have a happy ending.  I bought a Samsung A187 (from Amazon, $1 cheaper).  It works fine, so I bought a 2nd one, also works fine.

Reviews.Title: Very good Product
Reviews.Author: LeVelle T.  Henry
Reviews.Content: Bought this product at the beginning of 2011.  It's now March 2013 and it's still going strong.  Althought the facecover did come off.

Reviews.Title: everything it says to be.
Reviews.Author: cj
Reviews.Content: I couldnt ask for a better phone for the price. I am a huge texter and this phone is fine with texting.no complaints about the phone at all.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for kids
Reviews.Author: Vero
Reviews.Content: I bougth this phone for my 11 year old daughter mostly so we can reach each other when needed. She likes it and it serve well the purpose. Also I don't have to worry about the replacement cost if it is lost.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: TEXinKY
Reviews.Content: Great phone for the price.I text so needed keyboard,only complaint it doesnt have video.But i can live with it.Price was great and easy setup,also bought the skin for it for 98cents.

Reviews.Title: Horrible, Poor Quality Product, Nasty Customer Service!!
Reviews.Author: itiswhatitis21
Reviews.Content: Bought this back(Samsung A177) in Sept 2011 and the phone did not work properly right out the box. It would not maintain a full charge even after being on the charger for hours, and  after a new battery(same specs) still did not work, Messages were always stuck in the pending mode, and were not even sent at times.The problem got worst when i tried to return it and learned about the Complex Cardiac type Surgery i had to endure just to get a hold of someone at PDAGIANT. If you are buying anything online and the seller is PDA GIANT, Please stay clear of them... I finally got a hold a them and have not being able to return the item due to the time being expired. This is even after i have email traffic showing that i contacted them within a week after getting this crappy phone, and they failed to respond!!. I dont have any use for the phone, dont even care that they suck, just take their junk back.. thats all i want.Help yourself and avoid the headaches, please buy from someone else..DJ

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I wished
Reviews.Author: sandy
Reviews.Content: Okay great phone except dust gets in the speaker area onto the screen under the glass.... not so good...the glass screen cracked without dropping or misuse...just a hairline crack that is now spreading.... :(

Reviews.Title: SGH-A177
Reviews.Author: Caity Bee
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to give my phone. It got to me so quickly! It's incredibly light weight and does all the functions I need it to. However, I was unhappy that within just a few minutes of having it, I placed it in my pocket and it scratched the screen! Definitely get screen protectors if you are getting this phone. Another issue is that the camera is only .3 megapixels which is not a lot at all. Other than that, it works perfectly as my replacement phone.

Reviews.Title: You can do A LOT better
Reviews.Author: D. Mills
Reviews.Content: When my trusty Nokia clamshell slipped off my belt and threw itself into the rocks of a jetty, I decided to take a plunge on a Blackberry form factor.  This phone is so limited in standard capabilities (AT&T;/Consumer Cellular), I'd call it the worst choice I've ever made in mobile phones:-No microSD.  Therefore, storing anything like music or pictures on anything but it's limited internal memory is out of the question.-Proprietary connections.  No standard 3.5mm jack.  No standard USB port.-As a consequence of the two points above, you're stuck with Samsung's single earbud/mic combination.-Many basic Java third-party applications aren't supported.  Most obvious for me was Google Maps.  Search various forums and you'll find the same problem:  it downloads, but freezes halfway through the booting process.-Paltry .2MP (that's POINT 2MP) camera.  I'd like to have seen at least a standard 2MP.-No video capture.I suppose on the positive side, the rocker key and softkeys have firm tactile response.  The BB-size keyboard may be an issue for some, but that's the form factor.  If you're committed to the Blackberry style without the additional hardware and subscription costs, the Nokia C3-00 Unlocked Cell Phone with QWERTY, Dedicated E-mail Key, 2 MP Camera, Media Player, WLAN, and MicroSD Slot--U.S. Version with Warranty (Slate) is a much better choice for only a few more bucks via Consumer Cellular.If nothing else, the experience helped me reset my priorities on a text/smarter/web  phone.  I ended up with a 3G touchscreen slider (LG Rumor Touch), reluctantly dumping Consumer Cellular for a $25 unlimited data plan on Virgin Mobile...and that's another review.

Reviews.Title: Great for messaging.... that's about it.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for a pre paid plan for AT&T;, and I bought it because I wanted an inexpensive phone with a QWERTY keyboard.  That's what I got and I am very pleased with the messaging capabilities, but as it says in the title of this review, that's really all this phone is good for. That was the pro, here are the cons:-The call quality is terrible, I can barely hear people when they talk to me, which becomes obnoxious for both myself and them because I am constantly having to ask what they just said.-Battery life is pretty bad, I'm not the heaviest phone user but I still have to charge this phone almost every day.-The big middle button and left directional button cause me to lose money!  They both direct you to the web browser on the phone which charges you money from your balance, and when you go into phone settings you can change what every other button does, but you cannot change those 2 buttons! and the big one is constantly accidentally pressed because it sticks out so I will pull my phone out of my pocket and see that it's on the web browser when I don't want it to be!  I realize there is a lock keypad button on the phone but sometimes you can forget to lock it, and its really irritating getting charged for not doing anything.To sum it up, I would NOT recommend this phone unless the only thing you use a phone for is messaging!

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: C. Chen
Reviews.Content: Got the package. Plug in power core. At&t; logo pops up on and off repeatedly. After 5 hours cellphone is still off. very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: The anntenna strength is very weak.
Reviews.Author: SweetP
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone hoping that it would have an increased anntenna strength, better that the cheap company phone.  Come to find out, it is worse!!!  Basically it is an alarm clock!

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: agustin
Reviews.Content: I bought for friend and he loves it so much. I might get one for my son or daughter in the future.

Reviews.Title: Long-Suffering!!
Reviews.Author: Desiree M.
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone since 2011 and I love it! I call it my "knock-off Blackberry" lol. It's been long-suffering with me and I'd definitely recommend it to someone else who's not too into smartphones, but still wants a nice look for their phone. Enjoy! :)

Reviews.Title: bad choice
Reviews.Author: Chamin Mendis
Reviews.Content: i bought 3 of these and one had a fatal failure. Internal battery charger function failed in 2 months. Return policy is limited for 2 months and I just wasted the money. Not a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: excellent phone
Reviews.Author: griffen williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my son for when ever he needs it for emegencies, its well made, a dual sim card, solid piece, definately better made than a blackberry. Would recommend if they still made this phone.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: Ignacy Misztal
Reviews.Content: Seemed right size and right capabilities for an int'l phone. But stopped working soon after the purchase. Returned for credit.

Reviews.Title: Afghan Buddy!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Ryals
Reviews.Content: This phone served me well during my deployment to Afghanistan. This is how we communicated on our base. Passed it on to fellow members when I left!

Reviews.Title: Great phone - simple to use
Reviews.Author: Liz in Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a phone with a keyboard to simplify texting.  Not interested in a touch screen or bells and whistles - just an upgrade from my flip phone.  This phone is just what I wanted.  Very easy to learn to use - good camera.  The phone was brand new as advertised and came with all parts and instructions.  Battery holds a charge a long time.

Reviews.Title: Sansumg
Reviews.Author: donald hart
Reviews.Content: Sansumg, is a very good phone, durable, resistant. It has a very good audio as well as network signal. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: For the price-okay
Reviews.Author: eph
Reviews.Content: Not a bad phone for talking.  We have a large family and depend on texting.  My boys who have this phone cannot receive messages sent to multiple people at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Phone
Reviews.Author: Denise Fiorello
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this phone except the small numbers.  It's a compact phone with great capability, I suggest it.

Reviews.Title: It meets my needs.
Reviews.Author: Kenya Whatley
Reviews.Content: Pros: easy to use, web friendly,unlocked as stated. new condition.cons: tiny buttons, odd steps to take to send out a message.neutral: battery,receiption, camera

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Lokanath Suar
Reviews.Content: product is very good , technical specification is same as describe on web. packing is good & reach in time.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: jeff Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: I have ordered this same type of phone before and was great to use but this time the one I got was just turning off on its own and losing calls , So I returned it. It was probably just a bad single one this time.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Cloe' Picou "Cloe'"
Reviews.Content: GAVE IT AWAY.  NOT A GREAT PHONE.  KEYPAD IS TOO SMALL AND SO IS THE SCREEN.  NOT A GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY.

Reviews.Title: Samsung A117
Reviews.Author: marcella mann
Reviews.Content: I had this same phone before and was very happy with it.  This phone has also been good,  but the bluetooth I had with my old phone was not compatible with this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the money
Reviews.Author: SW
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a phone I could use and text with overseas.  This phone works great.  The battery life is very good, meaning it last for days (I don't use it for the internet)and it's easy to set up and use. The keyboard is a little small, but much better than a basic flip phone with no keyboard. I recomend this to anyone who travels overseas and is looking for a keyboard cell.

Reviews.Title: It's all about the SIM card
Reviews.Author: USTraveler
Reviews.Content: I particularly liked the full keyboard for sending text messages. My title refers to the fact that I first purchased a "world" SIM card for this phone while still in the states on-line and it did not allow me to use all the functions of this wonderful phone. Once I bought an in-country SIM card, everything worked well.

Reviews.Title: NOT quad-band ?
Reviews.Author: G. Pajer
Reviews.Content: I contacted Samsung about this model.  The agent told me that this is NOT a quad band phone:  it operates at 850 and 1900 GHz, i.e., not in most of Europe.  The Samsung web site does not publish this information.  Check for yourself to make sure.

Reviews.Title: Used for more than a year.
Reviews.Author: Arthur Hebert
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a decent phone. It's worn out now after more than a year (keyboard mistypes occasionally, battery not the best anymore, and signal strength is worse).Buying another one through the company I use Consumer Cellular.

Reviews.Title: Good for replacement
Reviews.Author: sam
Reviews.Content: my mom broke her flip phone and i thought it would be nice to get her started on something more advance. This phone is a simple phone looks like a blackberry runs like a flip phone. Not a hi tech phone. Web is horrible.  but again its just an unlock basic phoine w basic features.  fyi we used it with tmobile sim it works even though it says at&t; on the phone.

Reviews.Title: Good but......
Reviews.Author: Oldguy
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for a while. It works great as a phone for me. That's good because, that's what I bought it for. Don't like many things about this phone even though there are things to like. The ring is very quiet. I've missed calls even when expecting them. The calendar is junk in my opinion. The one big problem that seems to stand out on the AT&T; forum and is true for my phone too, after about 3 months the keys started acting up. Some regularly add double taps or don't work at all. I text more that talk so if the plan for this phone is to be a texting machine....you will not be happy with it after a few months. If you check out the reviews at AT&T; you'll see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Wanderer
Reviews.Content: Received the phone in a timely manner only to have it be unusable when it arrived.  I'd plug it in to charge it and a charging screen would briefly flash then go off.  I never did see what the menu even looks like.  Cellphonekings did take it back without hassle, though.

Reviews.Title: I guess it's a Ok phone
Reviews.Author: Rosita, Florida
Reviews.Content: It's a ok phone but not what I was looking for...I needed a bigger screen display...this one is to small.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: wtee
Reviews.Content: It's not the best phone but for what I had before I would say it's ok. I can say I can get my emails and I can text.  The sound is not that loud.  The keys are small but I can work with it.  Since I can't upgrade until 2013 from AT&T; this will work until I can find another unlock phone better than what I got.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: milotl
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice phone for my sister...and i found the Samsung A177 ...@ firts I was a little bit hesitated to buy it  for the price ..and i decided to go for it..I think it's a good phone. the only problem is if you have issue with your vision you should think twice before getting the phone bcuz the numbers are very small u might have difficulty to dial a # from the Samsung A177 phone.

Reviews.Title: diggin it!
Reviews.Author: Sellyg
Reviews.Content: I am diggin this...compared to the monster LG I had previously! Easy to use and nice and light!My son has the same phone and he is very happy as well!

Reviews.Title: Well...you get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: S. Henry "~S"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because my original Samsung touch screen phone died (screen blacked out and had no way of doing anything). I was still under my 2-year contract w/ AT&T; and so couldn't get an upgrade yet, so I selected this phone as a replacement since it got decent reviews, had the keypad and was pretty cheap for an unlocked phone.The pros: Looks nice, and sometimes gets reception.The cons: The reception is horrible!  When I'm in my house, I have to move around to find the right spot where this phone gets any reception at all, and making calls from everywhere else ususally take the phone a little while before it even connects.  In addition, the keys get stuck frequently, which makes texting pretty annoying!My experience has made me decide that all Samgung phoens are pieces of crap. I'll probably go for the iPhone or Droid when my contract is up! (luckily in just another month!)

Reviews.Title: I love this phone!!
Reviews.Author: AngieC
Reviews.Content: I have a pay as you go cell plan and I needed a more updated phone. The Samsung A177 was the best purchase for me. I transferred the Sim card myself (easy to do), downloaded a personal photo to use as my screensaver and I love it. Now I have a qwerty keyboard, a camera, and a phone that looks like a blackberry, but is so easy to use. I would recommend this phone to anyone who wants to update on a smaller budget and have the look and feel of a big budget phone. I also purchased a neoprene cover in hot pink and I am very, very happy with both items.

Reviews.Title: Very good phone. This product is of excellent quality. Meets all specifications provided by the manufacturer and its performance
Reviews.Author: Heuler
Reviews.Content: Very good phone. This product is of excellent quality. Meets all specifications provided by the manufacturer and its performance is superior. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: LoveLifeLovePeopleLoveGod
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this phone.  I actually had to buy him a second one because he broke his first one.  It's the easiest phone to use so buying another one was no question.  This buttons are easy for him to use he was surprised since their so small but using the keypad was no problem for him.

Reviews.Title: Phone purchase
Reviews.Author: Arlene
Reviews.Content: I am quite happy with the purchase of the samsung A177 unlocked.The phone is a gem.It accepted my sim card and I was making and receiving calls almost immediately. Thanks Amazon.I am a happy international shopper.

Reviews.Title: Best phone ever!
Reviews.Author: Team Jacob!
Reviews.Content: This is the secound phone that i have gotten and it is a lot better then my first one. Its great for tweens who want a full keyboard but they have to get one at a reasonable price. It has internet capability, calender, world time, and a lot more. Its also good for people who text all the time. The keys are small but surprisingly easy to text on. It also has a camera! I think if you were to get your child there first cellphone this would be the one. I reccomend this cellphone to ages 10+. Not good for older people because of the small keys.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Unlocked Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: brwneyes
Reviews.Content: Came unlocked as stated in the description.  Only had to insert SIM card and worked right away! Arrived as expected, and was in a brand new box with charger and had never been used.  Couldn't have asked for better service.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: Korie Frank
Reviews.Content: I was reading the comments and I didn't find them to be completely accurate.  I bought this phone a year ago and I have to confirm that the battery life is still pretty good.  It lasts me TWO full days on a single charge.  It used to be 3-4 when the phone was new, but aging has taken it's toll.  The phone is OK for texting if you have longer thumb fingernails since the QUWERTY keyboard seems to be compressed.  It's very easy to hit the wrong letters.  The phone itself is pretty easy to navigate through, but there isn't really that many features to brag about.  It does give you the ability to set multiple alarms which is nice for my busy schedule.  I may have a bias view on the reception since I live in the mountains of West Virginia, but this phone has not proven itself to be very sufficient at acquiring a signal.  I recieve dropped calls, moments of silence, missed calls, etc.  I have AT&T; and my other phones had good cell service but I've been told that many AT&T; phones around here are having trouble.  The camera is nothing special, it does take pictures but the quality is poor in comparison to other phones.  All in all, I'd have to say that this is a good phone for people who do not spend a lot of time using cellular phones or are less dependent on the new cell phone phenomenon (texting, internet data plans, ringtones, pictures, etc..)  The phone does not record videos either.  I probably wouldn't buy one here just because I believe that we'll be sweeping them off the sidewalks in 5 years.  Korie

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: rimbaud_1969@yahoo.com
Reviews.Content: A very good and relatively inexpensive phone. It is great for everything it offers. If I had to recommend this product there would be no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: IT'S NOT THE PHONE IT'S THE CHARGER
Reviews.Author: DDG "D.D.G"
Reviews.Content: recieved the phone on time it was packaged very well the only thing and the main thing is that the phone would not charge the charger is no good i know this becuase i had to use my charger from the previous phone to charge this phone and it worked. it's not the phone it's the charger.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: dylan
Reviews.Content: This phone serve's its purpose well.  It isn't too complicated(pretty easy to navigate), and still has all the features I wanted: The QWERTY and a camera. I've had no problems with the phone, I just slapped that sim in and I was ready to go.  I reccomend this phone to anyone who likes a nice simple phone.  Oh yes, I almost forgot, at 80 USD, this phone is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: Suffers from Samsung's antenna issue
Reviews.Author: Brian Lounsbury "...............................
Reviews.Content: Not a bad phone, not a great phone.  It had all the features I needed - great!  Internal antenna, two bars at best at home until I opened the laptop and then NOTHING - not so great when you are a supervisor.  I ended up going back to my old Nokia flip phone until I could do a little more research into which phone to get.  Also if you get the horizontal case that Amazon recommends for this phone, the blackjack like to try and connect the browser - again, no so great!

Reviews.Title: Love my Samsung!
Reviews.Author: R. Kithcart "deltachill"
Reviews.Content: The order came in a timely manner, actually before the receive date stated on the order.  The phone was new and in great condition.  I received all of the accessories that were to come with it.  The seller included information about the service they offered. I was pleased with this order.

Reviews.Title: bluetooth useless
Reviews.Author: A. Rose
Reviews.Content: I have this phone.  I really enjoy the sound quality, battery life and keyboard.  I cannot get the bluetooth to work at all.  Several members of my family also have bluetooth.  They can reach each other, but not me and I can not reach them.  It is quite frustrating.  It is harder to navigate the internet than on phones with a touchscreen.  Otherwise it is pretty good and certainly more durable than some I have had.

Reviews.Title: NOT A VERY GOOD PHONE
Reviews.Author: Vivian
Reviews.Content: I WOUND NOT RECOMMEND THIS PHONETHE KEYS ARE TOO SMALL EVEN FOR SMALL HANDSMEMORY IS ALMOST NON EXISTENT AFTER 35 TEXT MESSAGES YOU HAVE TO DELETE IN ORDER TO RECEIVE MORECAMERA  DOESN'T WORK EITHER UNABLE TO SEND PICTURES

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it looks
Reviews.Author: Mistie Gorajewski
Reviews.Content: The phone itself isn't bad for calling and very little texting. It DOES NOT blue tooth, has a VERY small memory, and is not near as fancy as it looks. For an emergency replacement phone it isn't bad, but I definitely won't be buying something like this again. I feel that I was ripped off for the price. I could have gotten a better deal somewhere else, but when we realized that the phone wasn't as great as we thought we had already registered it wil AT&T.;If your looking for a great phone for a great deal, keep looking. But if you just need something quick you found it.

Reviews.Title: Charger plug no good
Reviews.Author: Leonard Werner
Reviews.Content: The phone worked OK but the charger plug would not go into the phone. Because this was gift I did not want to return the whole phone, I had to buy a new charger.

Reviews.Title: SO SO
Reviews.Author: Ashlee
Reviews.Content: This phone does the job, but there isn't anything fancy about it...very basic.  The buttons are also extremely small, so don't buy if you have large fingers!  Not bad for the price though.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: Everytime you touch a key or button it tries to take you to some browser to get online and get advertisement's.It sucks!!!!!!!I wanted a phone, not a continous ad machine.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Catherine Gon
Reviews.Content: Great phone, got it for a friend. keyboard works great and has a simple look for a text messaging phone. Only problem my friend had was using the AIM on it because it would not let him sign in, but other than that, a great phone for those who don't need a stylish phone for texting.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Sharon T.
Reviews.Content: I  Love the phone great feathers....just great. I am really going to have fun using my phone, and great price too.

Reviews.Title: Samsung A177 Unlocked
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: I like the phone. I have only been using it for a short while but I am happy so far, an improvement from the previous one.  I just need a phone to make and receive calls;  send and receive text(es) I don't know how the plural of text is spelt. It's doing what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Brand New; No Complaints
Reviews.Author: Struggling77
Reviews.Content: I got this while it was $59.99 on special, and I've read all kinds of reviews about the case coming off and the battery falling out, but if you use a silicone skin or a snap-on case which you can get for less than $5 on here, then that CAN'T happen.  The only real shortcoming I see to this phone is the limited memory with no card slot, and supposedly you can't connect to other phones using the bluetooth, but you can download a free software from Samsung to transfer mp3 ringtones, pics, and videos from your computer to use with a usb connector that I bought packaged with a car charger and silicone skin for about $5 on here.  I think I'm going to love this phone...of course I don't use my phone as an music player (I already have one of those,) so I really only need my memory for pics and ringtones so I think I'll have plenty.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: VB
Reviews.Content: I had shipped this cell phone oversees for my parents. The first problem was1) It does not have a memory card slot (which I did not see while purchasing)2) Sound is very small for elderly to hearIt is not in the US otherwise I would have returned it immediately

Reviews.Title: Perfect for 12 year old son!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Sutherd
Reviews.Content: This phone is great for my son.  Its small and lightweight.  Its smaller than I thought it looked in the pictures on Amazon but thats just fine, it fits well in his pocket.  I gave it 4 staqrs for the simple fact that it does not have a slot for a memory card.  No biggie tho, a 12 year old doesnt need it. Also, excellent seller: Xenogearz, buy from this seller, NO COMPLAINTS AT ALL! Very prompt in letting me know when it was shipped and I had several dumb questions about the phone that were answered literally within minutes via email.

Reviews.Title: samsung cell phone
Reviews.Author: jay
Reviews.Content: Well, the reason i gave this phone a bad review is because they couldnt get it activated. my phone company had 2 send me another phone. They said maybe  the seller had a block on it are something. I liked the phone,but by me not being able to activate, cause me to give it a bad review.

Reviews.Title: Phone is not unlocked
Reviews.Author: Walker
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for unlocked phone,don't buy this unless you are att...description says the phone is unlocked but when I got it,it was stil locked.

Reviews.Title: notification
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: 2 of: Samsung A177 Unlocked QuadBand Phone with QWERTY Keyboard and Camera - US Warranty - Black, i dont recive my stuff please ship it again

Reviews.Title: is a regular cellphone
Reviews.Author: Lucy
Reviews.Content: is a good looking cellphone, easy to use, but the keyboard is super small is not easy to see the letters, numbers and choose your selection, the keyboard like for be used for a little kid is too small, the quality of the image is not good and you cannot record a video because this option is not aviable. Either can use the bluethooth.... dont work!!but if you live in venezuela and you don't care about my review... buy it because work perfectly there

Reviews.Title: A177
Reviews.Author: isabella carasco
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 12 year old son and i use it some time. IT IS JUNK. first of all if you are on a daily plan without a data plan your minutes go quick. when you go on google and type in a search thats a dollar there. and the internet button is very easy to press so when you press thats like $0.19. also if you drop it, the battery comes out and the battery cover comes off. then you have to go through the long reboot. also when you first get the phone you have to have soo... much info and you can only call from a homeline. you cant put money on it until you call the or go on the internet for them to activate. if you get a live wallpaper, it will eat up all your battery power so dont get fooled to buy one. the camera is good in light but at night it is like a 1990 camera. horrible. Anyway this phone is a good choice for starters but there are way better and way worst

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported.
2.4 inch Display - 64K TFT-LCD (technology), 176x220 resolution
Camera - VGA, 640 x 480, 320 x 240, and 220 x 165 (resolution); 4x Digital Zoom
Talk time - up to 5hrs. Standby time - up to 250hrs.
Poly Ringtones - 64 Note Polyphonic Music Tones/MP3 Music Tones
It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung A177 Unlocked QuadBand Phone with QWERTY Keyboard and Camera - US Warranty - Black
